channel.title: Best RTS game?
channel.description:
What is the best RTS game (the ones where you control an army etc.), preferably one that takes place in medieval times?
I'm trying to find the perfect one.

item.title: Best RTS game?
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

Zach1188:

I just finished downloading Warcraft 3. There were 2 CDs, one of them was just Warcraft3, and the other was Warcraft3 The Frozen Throne. Whats that all about? An add-on or what?

Strong hold 2, EE2 (nice for multiplayer ^^),Rome total war(This actually takes a year to recruit a unit in one town,city,and empire. But this is before mediveal times, also one year is when you end your turn so other factions can make moves.)

Read full topic

item.title: Best RTS game?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Nixer:

The several Total War games as Rome:Total War and Medieval 2: Total War. The exiting thing is that youre on a world map and building up your cities etc. And the battles youre vieving the hole battlefield and moving your troops around. Im bad in explaining so watch a video of the games if you dont understand me.

Holy shit, massive grave dig.

Read full topic

item.title: Best RTS game?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Try the Tzar demo.

It’s an older game, but it has many RPG elements, and is extremely deep.

softlookup.com

Download Tzar: The Burden of the Crown

Tzar: The Burden of the Crown , is a real-time strategy game in which you must recover the rightful leadership of Keanor.

item.title: Best RTS game?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Nevermind on the lag problem. My computer was really in need of a reformat anyways, so I reformatted it and reinstalled WIII, and it runs smoothly now.

Btw, my GPU was an Ati MobilityRadeon X300, and the drivers were already up to date.

@MoO wrote:

Iolo System mechanic… run it and see what the prob is (by the sound of it your computer is in dire need of a defragmentation/everything else :p)

Also as PaulT said try updating your video drivers (post what kind of video card it is, that may be the problem)

item.title: Best RTS game?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Now I'm having a problem with Warcraft 3. It just started doing this. When I play, animations, like fire, and troops walking around freeze. But when I move my mouse to the side of the screen or roll the mouse wheel to pan the camera, that goes perfectly smoothly, while my soldiers get really laggy. For example, an army of archers or something will be running, then they will lag an freeze, while the camera is panning around VERY smoothly.

I tried getting rid of spyware, uninstalling un-needed programs, and even tried using i8kfangui and turned my fans up so it would cool my GPU and CPU. Still having problems. I havn’t defragmented my computer in a long time, but i doubt thats the problem because it just started this morning. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Update video drivers?

Read full topic

item.title: Best RTS game?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Now I’m having a problem with Warcraft 3. It just started doing this. When I play, animations, like fire, and troops walking around freeze. But when I move my mouse to the side of the screen or roll the mouse wheel to pan the camera, that goes perfectly smoothly, while my soldiers get really laggy. For example, an army of archers or something will be running, then they will lag an freeze, while the camera is panning around VERY smoothly.

I tried getting rid of spyware, uninstalling un-needed programs, and even tried using i8kfangui and turned my fans up so it would cool my GPU and CPU. Still having problems. I havn’t defragmented my computer in a long time, but i doubt thats the problem because it just started this morning. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Read full topic
